title: Web UI: Select all/Clear selection does not sync checkbox state
description:
Context:
- Selection controls set `st.session_state["selected_ids"]` and rerun (`scripts/web_ui.py:1402-1413`).
- Each result checkbox uses its own key (`sel_{paper_id}_{idx}`) and writes back into `selected_ids` (`scripts/web_ui.py:1590-1594`).
- Streamlit preserves checkbox state by key, so "Select all" and "Clear selection" do not override existing checkbox values.

Impact:
- "Select all" and "Clear selection" appear to do nothing once checkboxes are set.
- Exports can use stale selections.

Repro:
1. Check a few result boxes.
2. Click "Clear selection".
3. The checkboxes remain checked on rerun.

Suggested fix:
- When selecting all or clearing, also reset the `sel_*` checkbox keys, or derive selection directly from checkbox state without a separate `selected_ids` set.

References:
- `scripts/web_ui.py:1402`
- `scripts/web_ui.py:1590`
close_reason: Fixed by clearing checkbox widget keys (sel_*) from session state before updating selected_ids. This forces Streamlit to reinitialize checkboxes with the new value parameter on rerun.

title: MCP queries should auto-save to query_results
description:
## Problem

When queries are made via Claude Code using MCP tools (litris_search, litris_get_paper, etc.), results are returned to the conversation but NOT automatically saved to data/query_results/. This differs from the CLI script query_index.py which auto-saves.

For complex multi-part research queries (like literature reviews), this means valuable synthesized outputs can be lost.

## Recommended Solutions

### Option 1: Add litris_save_query MCP tool (Recommended)
- New MCP tool that saves formatted results to data/query_results/
- Reuses existing save_results() from src/query/retrieval.py
- Explicit control - user invokes when needed
- Supports markdown, JSON, and PDF formats

### Option 2: Auto-save on MCP search
- Have litris_search auto-save every query result
- Pro: No extra step required
- Con: Creates many files for exploratory queries

### Option 3: Add /save-query skill
- Claude Code skill to save conversation research output
- Can capture multi-part synthesized queries (not just raw results)
- More complex - needs to format conversation output

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] MCP queries can be saved to data/query_results/
- [ ] Saved files follow existing naming convention (YYYY-MM-DD_query-slug.md)
- [ ] PDF export supported
- [ ] latest.md symlink updated
close_reason: Implemented litris_save_query MCP tool in src/mcp/server.py; saves markdown and PDF to query_results/

- Example: title = '[Click me](javascript:alert(1))' could render as link

Fix:
- Use st.text or escape markdown special characters
- Or validate/sanitize titles before display

title: Web UI: Keyboard navigation index not reset on new search
description:
Context:
- Keyboard shortcuts use focusedCardIndex to track current position (web_ui.py:249)
- focusedCardIndex is a JavaScript global variable that persists in browser memory
- Escape key resets the index (web_ui.py:300)

UX Issue:
1. User navigates to result 5 using j/k keys
2. User runs a new search
3. New results load, but focusedCardIndex is still 5
4. Pressing j continues from position 5, not 0
5. If fewer results exist, index could be out of bounds

Fix:
- Reset focusedCardIndex when result cards change (MutationObserver)
- Or add window.resetLitrisNav function callable on page rerun
- Or always reset on first j/k keypress if cards changed

References:
- scripts/web_ui.py:249
- scripts/web_ui.py:300
